peak to valley time

neurotools.waveform.getWAHP(wf)[source]¶

Width at half peak

neurotools.waveform.is_thin(wf, thr=0.98, time=123)[source]¶

Determine whether a mean-waveform is a thin spike. Uses amplituce 300 μs post-spike. This procedure was trained on well-isolated cells. See the 20160802_waveform_segmentation notebook for how threshold was derived

neurotools.waveform.is_thin_pvt(wf, thr=52.0349055393)[source]¶

Determine whether a mean-waveform is a thin spike. Uses peak-to-valley time

neurotools.waveform.minmax(wf)[source]¶

Normalize waveform based on extrema

neurotools.waveform.normalized_waveform(wf)[source]¶
neurotools.waveform.process((i, f))[source]¶

Get high-dimensional feature description of data. TODO: remove; how did this even get here?

neurotools.waveform.realign(snip)[source]¶

Realign waveforms to peak

neurotools.waveform.realign_special(snip)[source]¶

Realign waveforms to peak, pad out missing values
